snippet: Albany may give Mayor Bill de Blasio financing for universal prekindergarten, but the anticipated failure of his preferred revenue mechanism illustrates the limits of mayoral power.
abstract: New York State lawmakers appear headed to giving New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio at least some financing for universal prekindergarten, but will forgo his proposed tax increase on those earning more than $500,000; anticipated failure of de Blasio's plan to raise taxes on the wealthy will represent significant setback for his agenda and may illustrate the limits of mayoral power.

byline.original: By JAVIER C. HERNÁNDEZ and THOMAS KAPLAN

lead_paragraph: Albany may give Mayor Bill de Blasio financing for universal prekindergarten, but the anticipated failure of his preferred revenue mechanism illustrates the limits of mayoral power.

headline.main: Mayor’s Pre-K Tax Drive: Views Vary on Its Success as Widely as on Its Merits
headline.print_headline: Mayor’s Pre-K Tax Drive: Views Vary on Its Success as Widely as on Its Merits
